llama2_direct_sole-planning_results:
Day 1 (March 23rd): Akron to Atlanta

* Distance: 1114 km (692 miles)
* Duration: 10 hours 10 minutes
* Cost: $55 (taxi) or $8,900 (self-driving)

Recommendation: Take a self-driving car from Akron to Atlanta. The journey takes around 10 hours and 10 minutes, and you can enjoy the scenic route along the way. If you prefer to take a taxi, it will cost around $55.

Day 2 (March 24th): Atlanta

* Activities: Visit Centennial Olympic Park, Georgia Aquarium, World of Coca-Cola
* Restaurants: Try American and Chinese cuisine at local restaurants
* Budget: $100 per person for activities and meals

Recommendation: Spend the day exploring Atlanta's top attractions like Centennial Olympic Park, Georgia Aquarium, and World of Coca-Cola. For lunch, head to local American and Chinese restaurants.

Day 3 (March 25th): Atlanta to Augusta

* Distance: 1031 km (635 miles)
* Duration: 9 hours 36 minutes
* Cost: $89 (taxi) or $6,667 (self-driving)

Recommendation: Take a self-driving car from Atlanta to Augusta. The journey takes around 9 hours and 36 minutes, and you can enjoy the scenic route along the way. If you prefer to take a taxi, it will cost around $89.

Day 4 (March 26th): Augusta

* Activities: Visit the Augusta Canal National Heritage Area, Summerville Baptist Church
* Restaurants: Try Southern cuisine at local restaurants
* Budget: $100 per person for activities and meals

Recommendation: Explore Augusta's history and culture by visiting the Augusta Canal National Heritage Area and Summerville Baptist Church. For lunch, head to local Southern restaurants.

Day 5 (March 27th): Augusta to Decatur

* Distance: 229 km (142 miles)
* Duration: 2 hours 19 minutes
* Cost: $23 (taxi) or $1,110 (self-driving)

Recommendation: Take a self-driving car from Augusta to Decatur. The journey takes around 2 hours and 19 minutes, and you can enjoy the scenic route along the way. If you prefer to take a taxi, it will cost around $23.

Day 6 (March 28th): Decatur

* Activities: Visit the Scenic Railroad, Oakhurst Porch Fest
* Restaurants: Try Southern cuisine at local restaurants
* Budget: $100 per person for activities and meals

Recommendation: Spend the day exploring Decatur's top attractions like the Scenic Railroad and Oakhurst Porch Fest. For lunch, head to local Southern restaurants.

Day 7 (March 29th): Decatur to Akron

* Distance: 13.0 km (8.1 miles)
* Duration: 19 minutes
* Cost: $0 (taxi) or $6,667 (self-driving)

Recommendation: Take a self-driving car from Decatur to Akron. The journey takes around 19 minutes, and you can enjoy the scenic route along the way. If you prefer to take a taxi, it will cost around $0.

Budget Breakdown:

* Transportation (self-driving car or taxi): $5,667
* Activities and meals: $1,800
* Total budget: $7,467

Note: The above itinerary and budget are based on the assumption that you will be traveling during the week of March 23rd to March 29th, 2022. Prices and availability may vary depending on the time of year and other factors.
